At the moment, the prevention aimed at reducing transmission in the community is the best alternative, indicating that enhanced public health interventions, including social distancing, use of masks and movement restrictions should be implemented to bring the COVID-19 pandemic under control. Aggressive isolation measures including travel restriction in China, have successfully led to a progressive reduction of COVID-19 cases.
8 Kissler and colleagues, simulated the relaxation of the protective measures using a post-pandemic mathematical model.
9 The authors demonstrated that social isolation will be necessary at the best scenario until 2021, and reaffirmed the need and importance of maintaining social isolation. They also suggested that in the absence of such restrictions, the pandemic could last until 2024. Thus, in this context, the search for new medicines available to combat this disease is urgent.
